Thinking Elixir 231: Pretty Error and OTP Raw Mode

3 Dec 2024 by brainlid

Episode 231 of Thinking Elixir. News includes Dave Luciaâ€™s PR making Elixirâ€™s protocol errors more readable, OTP 28 introducing a â€œraw modeâ€ for immediate CLI input processing, SaÅ¡a JuriÄ‡â€™s â€œAgainst the Grainâ€ talk on YouTube about a bespoke Kafka client, Johanna Larssonâ€™s new site listing Elixir events, DockYardâ€™s official acceptance of native application contracts highlighting the readiness of their LiveView Native library, and Brian Cardarellaâ€™s teased Motion.dev wrapper enhancing animations in LiveView, and more!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lkszZDm2e5Y

item.description:
ã€

Why did the Elixir application keep running despite dependency shutdown?

6 Dec 2024 by andreyuhai

Recently, weâ€™ve had an incident with one of our RPC services on production. The root cause was an issue with a PgBouncer instance going down. Although PgBouncer was eventually restored and became operational, our service remained partially functional until the pods were restarted. In this article, Iâ€™ll document the root cause of the issue and how we fixed it, effectively answering the question posed in the title.

https://burakaymakci.com/why-did-the-elixir-application-keep-running-despite-dependency-shutdown/

A complete guide to LiveView v1.0.0's new syntax

6 Dec 2024 by TheArrowsmith

LiveView v1.0.0 is finally here! The biggest change from 0.20 is that thereâ€™s a new way to render data in HEEx: {â€¦} is now available as an alternative to <%= â€¦ %>.

In my new post I explain everything you need to know about this new feature, including some subtler details:

item.title: ã€JSONPathEx: A New Elixir Library for Parsing and Evaluating JSONPath Expressionsã€‘JSONPathExï¼šç”¨äºè§£æå’Œè¯„ä¼° JSONPath è¡¨è¾¾å¼çš„æ–° Elixir åº“
item.description:
ã€

JSONPathEx: A New Elixir Library for Parsing and Evaluating JSONPath Expressions

3 Dec 2024 by b-erdem

JSONPathEx is an Elixir library designed for parsing and evaluating JSONPath expressions. It provides tools to transform JSONPath syntax into an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) and evaluate these expressions against JSON data. The library supports a variety of JSONPath features, including root selectors, recursive descent, array slicing, filters, and functions like length(), sum(), min(), and max(). Built with NimbleParsec, JSONPathEx is modular, making it easy to extend or customize. The project is open source and available on GitHub and Hex.pm. Contributions, feedback, and suggestions are welcome!

item.title: ã€YOLO - Real-Time Object Detection Simplifiedã€‘YOLO - ç®€åŒ–çš„å®æ—¶ç›®æ ‡æ£€æµ‹
item.description:
ã€

YOLO - Real-Time Object Detection Simplified

6 Dec 2024 by alvises

https://github.com/poeticoding/yolo_elixir

Iâ€™m thrilled to share YOLO, my first Elixir library, designed to make real-time object detection simple and accessible for Elixir developers. Built around the power of YOLOv8, this library lets you detect objects in images or videos with speed and ease.

Hereâ€™s what Iâ€™ve worked on:

  • Fast detections: Just 38ms per image on a MacBook Air M3 with EXLA.
  • Simple API: Load models and detect objects in just two steps.
  • Extensibility: Built for YOLOv8, with support for custom models on the way.
  • Rust-powered NMS: Optional Rust NIF for blazing-fast post-processing.

Elixir Streams |> Using GenServer.reply/2 to synchronize the asynchronous

5 Dec 2024 by germsvel

I was trying to explain this the other day. So, naturally, I made a video. ğŸ˜„

How do we coordinate a message that runs through a GenServerâ€™s handle_call/3 and handle_info/2 in a way that makes it seem synchronous from the callerâ€™s perspective?

The secret: GenServer.reply/2

Check out this short video! ğŸ‘‡

https://www.elixirstreams.com/tips/sync-the-async-within-a-genserver
